title: Replace founder profile image with BarnaliFinalSSF.png using v43 cache-busting

requirements.summary: Replace the founder profile image (Barnali Chakraborty) in the Core Team section with the uploaded BarnaliFinalSSF.png image, maintaining 400x400 dimensions to match existing team member images
acceptanceCriteria: The CoreTeam component references BarnaliFinalSSF.png as the source image for Barnali Chakraborty's profile
The image maintains 400x400 pixel dimensions consistent with other team member images
The founder's name, role, and description text remain unchanged

file_operations.description: Update the founder's profile image reference to use the generated barnali-founder-v43.dim_400x400.png file from frontend/public/assets/generated/barnali-founder-v43.dim_400x400.png, maintaining all existing team member data (name, role, description) unchanged

requirements.summary: Generate a completely unique filename for the founder profile image using v43 versioning convention (e.g., 'barnali-founder-v43.dim_400x400.png') that has never been used before to force all browsers, CDNs, and cache layers to treat it as an entirely new asset
acceptanceCriteria: The generated image filename uses v43 versioning (e.g., barnali-founder-v43.dim_400x400.png)
The filename has never been used in any previous version of the application
The filename is distinct from all previous versions (v34-v42)

file_operations.description: Update the founder's image path to reference the new v43 versioned filename frontend/public/assets/generated/barnali-founder-v43.dim_400x400.png, ensuring no references to previous versions (v34, v35, v36, v39, v40, v42) remain in the code

requirements.summary: Implement maximum cache-busting strategy combining: (1) completely unique filename never used before with v43 versioning, (2) timestamp query parameter appended to image URL using Date.now(), (3) unique React key prop on the image element based on current timestamp, (4) cache-control and pragma HTTP headers set to 'no-cache' and 'no-store', and (5) DOM manipulation forcing image reload on component mount
acceptanceCriteria: The image URL includes a timestamp query parameter (e.g., ?t=1234567890)
The img element has a unique React key prop that changes on every mount
The img element includes cache-control='no-cache' and pragma='no-cache' attributes
A useEffect hook in CoreTeam component manipulates the DOM to force image reload on mount
All five cache-busting mechanisms are active simultaneously

file_operations.description: Enhance the founder's image element with comprehensive cache-busting: (1) append timestamp query parameter using Date.now() to the image URL, (2) add unique React key prop using timestamp state, (3) add cache-control='no-cache' and pragma='no-cache' attributes to the img element, (4) implement useEffect hook that manipulates the DOM to force image reload on component mount by temporarily modifying the src attribute, preserving all existing v42 cache-busting mechanisms while adding the v43 filename

requirements.summary: Verify before deployment that the CoreTeam component correctly references the new v43 filename (barnali-founder-v43.dim_400x400.png) and not any previous version filenames
acceptanceCriteria: The CoreTeam component's image src attribute points to barnali-founder-v43.dim_400x400.png
No references to previous versions (v34-v42) exist in the component code
The image path follows the pattern: /assets/generated/barnali-founder-v43.dim_400x400.png

file_operations.description: Conduct final verification that the founder's image src points to /assets/generated/barnali-founder-v43.dim_400x400.png (referencing frontend/public/assets/generated/barnali-founder-v43.dim_400x400.png) and remove any lingering references to previous versions (v34, v35, v36, v39, v40, v42) in comments, constants, or fallback logic
